intro: Uralepis composita, commonly known as the composite uralepis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat, composite head, typical of the daisy family. Uralepis composita is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to arid conditions.
